Excluding Files from a Project

Some types of files will never be added to a project, although they may reside in a working folder. For example, suppose you are creating files with an application that makes an automatic backup (.bak) copies of each file every time you save the file. Although your working folder might contain several .bak files, you would have no reason to check them into (or out of ) the application. Therefore, you should exclude them from the project view.

Excluding files is done on a per-folder basis. However, exclude lists can be inherited from parent folders.

To exclude files from a folder:

  1. Select a folder from the application folder hierarchy.

  2. Select Folder > Properties from the Folder menu. The Folder Properties dialog opens.

  3. Select the Exclude tab. The Exclude tab does not affect files that are already part of the project.

  4. Select one of the following:

    • Inherit and use local exclude lists button to exclude files that match the exclude list specifications set for this folder as well as those of its parent folder. If the Local exclude list text box does not yet include any file specifications, add them.

    • Use local exclude list to exclude files that match the exclude list specifications set for this folder. If the Local exclude list text box does not yet include any file specifications, add them.

    • Don't use exclude list button to include all files.

  5. Click OK.
